item.title: Tesla‚Äôs Cybertruck Causes A Maddening Bug In Fortnite
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/tesla-s-cybertruck-causes-a-maddening-bug-in-fortnite-1851618706

The Cybertruck has been a menace on America‚Äôs roads since it launched, slicing open one owner‚Äôs leg, annoying residents of Maine and trapping all kinds of limbs in its openings. Now, it turns out that the angular atrocity is also ruining the virtual world as well.

Suggested Reading

The Top 10 Most-Played Games On Steam Deck: August 2023 Edition

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

The Cybertruck is available to drive in games like Fortnite and Rocket League as part of a Summer Road Trip bundle that gamers have been able to download for a few weeks. However, using the Cybertruck in Fortnite sparks a bug that can brick your progress on the game, reports Engadget.

When you hop in any other truck on the game and regenerate it as a Cybertruck, the move can reportedly prevent certain weapons from working, according to Engadget:

Posts about the Cybertruck glitch appeared on Reddit and YouTube. The glitch happens when you morph a truck into Elon Musk‚Äôs boxy behemoth. On exiting the vehicle, a bug rendered your Nitro Fists, the melee weapon that‚Äôs pretty much exactly how it sounds, completely useless.

The glitch was showcased by YouTuber Tabor Hill, who uploaded gameplay footage of the bug this week. In the clip, the player shows their weapons working fine before they hop into a Mercedes G-Wagen and transform it into a Cybertruck. After driving around for a few seconds, they hop out again and their weapons don‚Äôt work.

That‚Äôs a pretty irritating glitch! It‚Äôs not uncommon for new game aspects to have some sort of issue, but this had to be frustrating for players. Thankfully, a fix for the bug was rolled out to Fornite players who are now free to cosplay being a Tesla bro.

The Cybertruck has also become something of a culture war on wheels since it launched. The car is loved by Tesla fans but hated by most normal people, who are exactly the kind of customers that Tesla is struggling to sell to right now.

This story originally appeared on Jalopnik, our sister site, on Friday, August 2.

item.title: Geralt voice actor confirms he will be "part of" The Witcher 4
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/geralt-voice-actor-confirms-he-will-be-part-of-the-witcher-4

"I could be lying through my teeth. But I'm not. Or am I?"

While we may have already known that Geralt will not be the focus of CD Projekt Red's next The Witcher game, voice actor Doug Cockle has confirmed he'll at least be reprising the role in The Witcher 4.

In an interview in which Cockle tries to remember his most iconic lines, the voice of Geralt of Rivia confirmed that Geralt will be "part of the [next] game", but the storyline will "not be about him this time".

"Witcher 4 has been announced," he teased (thanks, PC Gamer) halfway through his famous lines test. "I can't say anything about it.

"What we know is that Geralt will be part of the game, we just don't know how much, and the game won't focus on Geralt. So it's not about him this time.

"We don't know who it's about. I'm excited to find out. I want to know!" he added. "I have not seen any script yet - I mean, I couldn't tell you if I did. This is the thing, so I could be lying through my teeth. But I'm not. Or am I?"

After a few set photo leaks earlier in the month, we now have an official first look at Liam Hemsworth as Geralt of Rivia in season four of Netflix's The Witcher series.

A new image, along with a short piece of footage, shows the former Hunger Games actor with Geralt's white locks and a suitably moody stare.

item.title: Fortnite and Marvel confirm new crossover season starring Doctor Doom, as Disney integration deepens
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/fortnite-and-marvel-confirm-new-crossover-season-starring-doctor-doom-as-disney-integration-deepens

Plus: Incredibles! Cruella! Grogu!

Fortnite will host another Marvel-focused season, this time centering on Doctor Doom, accompanied by yet more superhero faces for Epic Games' evergreen battle royale.

Details of Fortnite's next season, named Fortnite x Marvel: Absolute Doom, were announced this morning during Disney's D23 fan event, and livestreamed in Fortnite itself.

Marvel boss Kevin Feige was joined on stage by Star Wars legend Dave Filoni and Pixar head honcho Pete Doctor, who additionally detailed a treasure trove of Disney franchises also set to get crossovers in Fortnite over the coming months, as Epic Games' integration with the Mouse House deepens.

Fortnite x Marvel: Absolute Doom will kick off this Friday, 16th August, and include Marvel heroes Gwenpool, War Machine, Emma Frost, Mysterio, Shuri and Doctor Doom in its battle pass. Two Fortnite favourites with new Marvel looks are also included: Captain Jonesy, who wears a version of Cap's suit and wields his shield, plus Peelverine, the latest version of Fortnite's favourite banana, now dressed as Logan.

A trailer for the new season also featured a furrier look for Fortnite's much-loved muscley cat Meowscles, apparently inspired by Marvel's Sabretooth, while fans at the event report being told that a Fishstick variant of Deadpool, named Fishpool, is also being worked on. Meanwhile, an Epic blog post states the Fantastic Four are also set to be added. All of these skins will likely be sold separately to the battle pass - either via the game's Item Shop or Crew subscription.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The past 24 hours have been busy for Fortnite, which is currently wrapping up its Mad Max-inspired wasteland season. In a mini live event held in-game last night, around a million players were in-game as this season's villain Megalo Don got his comeuppance, when his pipeline of powerful Nitro fuel detonated in spectacular style. The suggestion was that Doctor Doom interfered to cause the explosion, while the aftermath also saw the return of Pandora's Box, a menacing threat that has plagued Fortnite's battle royale Island through the course of its current Chapter 5 storyline.

More pertinent to all of the announcements last night, perhaps, is Epic Games' real-life $1.5bn deal with Disney to integrate its Fortnite metaverse with the entertainment powerhouse. I can't remember the last time Disney wheeled out such a senior trio of execs to announce more skins for a video game, but such is the importance - and oppurtunity - of Fortnite as a part of popular culture.

Leaks suggest next season will add a permanent and separate Disney store to Fortnite, alongside its Item Shop, as a way to sell and track your purchased vault of Disney content. This, perhaps, may also be used to mark compatibility with a future Fortnite Disney mode.

RUMOR: FIRST LOOK AT AN UPCOMING DISNEY ITEM SHOP üî•

This image was sent to @HYPEX & me earlier today. The person who sent this to us explained that Epic Games is "developing a Disney IP store in Fortnite" üëÄ

If accurate, this update might be announced at D23 tomorrow! pic.twitter.com/7HPxUGiaUr

‚Äî Shiina (@ShiinaBR) August 9, 2024

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As well as adding the many Marvel heroes above, Fortnite will swell its character roster to include IG-88 and Moff Gideon from Star Wars hit show The Mandalorian, as well as a new Grogu back bling, as soon as next week.

Fortnite's first Pixar crossover is also on the way, appropriately with the animation studio's own superheroes, as Frozone, Mr Incredible and Elasticgirl from The Incredibles become available this autumn. Finally, classic Disney villains such as Cruella de Vil, Hook and Maleficient will also be available in the autumn.

The announcement of a Fortnite season focusing on Doctor Doom is well-timed with Marvel Studios' own announcement it will pivot to focusing on the character, played by Robert Downey Jr., in the next Avengers film. It's unclear how - if at all - this season will tie into that, or acknowledge Doctor Doom was already part of Fortnite's storyline several years back, when its first dedicated Marvel season ran. That season featured Thor, She-Hulk, Groot, Storm, Dr. Doom, Mystique, Iron Man and Wolverine, characters Epic Games has clearly steered away from repeating with new skins here, and memorably ended in a spectacular major live event where the Marvel heroes teamed up to take down Galactus - something that will take some beating.

item.title: Fortnite‚Äôs Absolute Doom Trailer Brings Marvel Back to the Island
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fortnites-absolute-doom-trailer-brings-marvel-back-to-the-island/

Fortnite has released a new trailer for their upcoming Absolute Doom season. Chapter 5, Season 4 starts on August 16 and will bring beloved Marvel characters back to the island.

Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 4‚Äôs Narrative

The new Fortnite trailer features the season‚Äôs highlight, Dr. Doom, who seems to be up to no good. We see Jonesy wearing Captain America‚Äôs outfit, swinging around his shield to take down enemies.

The trailer showcases the upcoming season‚Äôs overarching plot, with Dr. Doom seemingly rescuing Mysterio from a maximum-security prison. The iron-fisted doctor has also erected a full-fledged castle in the middle of the island, which will probably be a new POI in the upcoming season.

To take Dr. Doom‚Äôs evil forces down, Jonesy and the other Fortnite characters join hands with the X-Men, as we see Cyclops, Colossus, Jubilee, and others join the fray. Players also glimpse Peely Wolverine (Peelverine) as he reenacts Logan‚Äôs iconic escape from the Weapon X facility.

New Gameplay Features

Halfway through the trailer, we received a gameplay showcase, revealing all the new toys players can play with in the upcoming Fortnite season. First up was Captain America‚Äôs Shield, which players can swing to take down multiple enemies at a time or use to ram into other players and their builds. Next, we got to see Black Panther‚Äôs Claws, which seem to be a new melee weapon, perfect for close-ranged combat.

Then, Gwenpool shows up, wearing parts of Tony Stark‚Äôs Iron Suit, allowing her to zoom through the map and use the Unibeam to unleash devastating attacks. We also saw War Machine in action; his suit seems like an absolute tank. Last but not least was Dr. Doom, who unleashed a beam of devastating energy at other Marvel characters.

Battle Pass Details

Fortnite has revealed in the trailer description that players will receive new items such as Dual Micro SMGs, Captain America‚Äôs Shield, or War Machine‚Äôs Arsenal in the Absolute Doom Season. Also, next season‚Äôs Battle Pass will cost 950 V-Bucks and feature rewards such as Gwenpool, War MachinePeelverine, Emma Frost, Captain Jonesy, Mysterio, and Shuri. Fortnite will also feature Dr Doom‚Äôs skin through Battle Pass quests in September.

According to the latest announcement, Fortnite‚Äôs battle pass items will no longer be exclusive. Also, their latest live stream with Disney had many reveals. What are your thoughts on Fortnite‚Äôs Absolute Doom season? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: MW2 Multiplayer Mod ‚ÄòH2M‚Äô Going Live on August 16
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/multiplayer-mod-mw2-h2m-live/

Recently, clips started surfacing online of content creators playing what looks like Modern Warfare 2 Remastered‚Äôs multiplayer offering ‚Äì which never surfaced. It‚Äôs actually a full-fledged multiplayer mod for MW Remastered, which was released almost ten years ago. It‚Äôs called the H2M Mod, and it has been in development for quite a while.

At first blush, it‚Äôs the most faithful recreation of 2009‚Äôs Modern Warfare 2 that I‚Äôve ever seen.

Take Me Back

For many Call of Duty fans, Modern Warfare 2 represents the pinnacle of the series. It boasted a flawless multiplayer platform that we still remember today, and it was a perfect expansion to the story mode that was kicked off in Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare. In 2016, Activision released Modern Warfare Remastered, which completely overhauled the original game, and in 2020, MW2‚Äôs campaign was remastered.

Now, a team of talented modders has pulled Modern Warfare 2‚Äôs multiplayer platform into 2016‚Äôs Modern Warfare Remastered. H2M features the full suite of maps, modes, weapons, and everything you fondly remember from the 2009 title, right down to elements of the UI and the sound palette.

It looks utterly phenomenal:

Typically, Activision Blizzard comes down hard on these fan-made creations, issuing cease and desist notices or ordering that they be taken offline, but this shouldn‚Äôt be the case this time. To play H2M, you‚Äôll need to own a copy of Modern Warfare Remastered on Steam (as it‚Äôs a PC-only mod), and the team behind the project has stressed they‚Äôre not accepting payments for the creation.

It‚Äôs truly the next generation of Modern Warfare 2. With redesigned levelling systems, menus, and an overhaul to the killstreak system, players can enjoy the game they know and love from fifteen years ago with a much more modern, up-to-date feel. When H2M is released on August 16, it‚Äôll come with 50 maps, some of which are single-player missions converted into playable multiplayer maps.

It‚Äôs insane.

item.title: Fortnite to Get Disney Villains, Incredibles Characters, and a Season With Doctor Doom | D23 2024
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/fortnite-to-get-disney-villains-incredibles-characters-and-a-season-with-doctor-doom-d23-2024

Marvel and Star Wars content drops next week.

Epic Games is working with Disney to bring some of its iconic villains, as well as a host of new Pixar, Star Wars, and Marvel characters, to Fortnite.

The latest Fortnite collaboration was revealed at the Disney Experiences Showcase at D23 2024. The latest crossover starts next week with Mandalorian characters like Grogu set to show up on August 12. Then, Fortnite‚Äôs next season will usher in the age of Doctor Doom with Chapter 5 Season 4: Absolute Doom, bringing more Marvel-themed skins and items for players to toy with on August 16. You can see a trailer for Absolute Doom below.

‚Äî Marvel Games (@MarvelGames) August 11, 2024

Doctor Doom is the latest Marvel centerpiece to worm its way into Fortnite, but Victor Von Doom isn't the only superpowered character to show up in the trailer. X-Men like Cable, Cyclops, Rogue, Jubilee, and Colossus have cameos, too, as does Spider-Man villain Mysterio. Some cosmetics and weapons based on characters like Sabretooth, Captain America, Iron Man, and Black Panther can also be seen in the footage, making it clear that Marvel's relationship with Fortnite still has a lot of life left in it.

Disney took the opportunity at its latest D23 showcase to prove that it's all in on Fortnite in more ways than one. This fall, Fortnite fans can look forward to appearances from a selection of iconic Disney villains like Maleficent, Cruella de Vil, and Captain Hook. Pixar characters are on the way, too. Specifically, Disney‚Äôs superhero family, the Incredibles, will show up in-game, with players able to enjoy content based on heroes like Mr. and Mrs. Incredible and Frozone.

These announcements follow the news that Disney aquired a $1.5 billion stake in Fortnite developer Epic Games in March. At the time, the company stated a desire to bolster its relationship with the studio and make a more significant investment in the games space in general. A laundry list of Fortnite character additions is surely only the beginning of what the partnership will bring. While we wait to see how the two companies will grow together, be sure to read up on some of the other announcements from tonight's Disney Experiences Showcase, which include new attractions based on Avatar and The Avengers.

item.title: Fortnite's New "Absolute Doom" Marvel Battle Pass Revealed, With War Machine, Dr. Doom
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnites-new-absolute-doom-marvel-battle-pass-revealed-with-war-machine-dr-doom/1100-6525700/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

We were promised some major Fortnite reveals at Disney's D23 event on Saturday--what else would warrant a livestream inside the game itself?--and major reveals is exactly what we got. The biggest was that Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 4, which begins August 16, will be a new Marvel-focused season, dubbed Absolute Doom--with a battle pass filled with Marvel skins, such as a new Peely called Peelverine.

What we have here in this trailer is the full battle pass reveal, plus looks at some of the new gameplay goodies we're going to get to play with. The battle pass lineup will consist of Gwenpool (the instant unlock), War Machine, Emma Frost, Shuri, Mysterio, Peelverine and Captain Jonesy as the skins you'll unlock by leveling up, and Doctor Doom will be the mid-season unlock, a la Magneto this season.

We also got a glimpse at the new Marvel powers, which appear to include Shuri's claws, War Machine's weapon rig, Iron Man's energy blasts and flight, Captain America's Shield, and Doctor Doom's gauntlets. It's notable that we saw nothing at all of the Fantastic Four during this.

That's huge, of course, but the D23 presentation also included some other shockers--they had assembled the creative heads of Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pixar, Lucasfilm and Marvel Studios. While each of them described these collaborations as extensions of their franchise storytelling, these announcements were all about new skins.

First revealed were several skins based on classic Disney animated villains--Cruella DeVille, Captain Hook, and Maleficent were shown, with the promise of a fall release, which could indicate they'll be part of Fortnitemares in October. Adding to that animated fun is the news that Fortnite will be receiving its first Pixar skins in the form of a collab with The Incredibles.

And while the change to battle pass exclusivity won't help you get the old Mandalorian skin and Grogu back bling, on August 12, skins for IG-11 and Moff Gideon will be added to the item shop and there will also be a new Grogu back bling available for those who missed the previous one.

item.title: This Vision Pro Virtual Boy emulator isn‚Äôt fancy, but it gets the job done
item.content:encoded:
https://www.theverge.com/2024/8/10/24217643/vision-pro-nintendo-virtual-boy-emulator-virtualfriend-impressions

The Vision Pro got its first Virtual Boy emulator in an app called VirtualFriend, finally giving me, a person with an irrational love for Nintendo‚Äôs most short-lived console, a chance to play it in immersive 3D once more. The app is also available for iOS and iPadOS, where it‚Äôs a virtually identical experience, minus the 3D effect.

The first games I played after downloading VirtualFriend were those I owned as a kid: Red Alarm, Wario Land, and Mario‚Äôs Tennis. I‚Äôm pleased to say that apart from some minor audio glitches in Red Alarm, the games run well ‚Äî it‚Äôs all just as I remember it.

GIF: VirtualFriend

VirtualFriend supports Bluetooth controllers and keyboard control on the Vision Pro, as well as touchscreen buttons if you‚Äôre playing on an iPhone or iPad. Visually, the games look as good as a Virtual Boy game can and have a little help from the app, which lets you customize the console‚Äôs two-tone color palette. VirtualFriend also has an eye adjustment slider that helps adjust the image if you find a particular game isn‚Äôt working for you.

The big missing features are controller mapping and the ability to save your game at any point using save states. (Developer Adam Gastineau acknowledged the latter in an open issue on the project‚Äôs GitHub page.)

Still, VirtualFriend is easy to recommend if you‚Äôre at all curious about playing Virtual Boy games or, like me, you once owned and loved the console. It‚Äôs free with the option to tip the developer, doesn‚Äôt show ads, and according to its App Store listing, won‚Äôt collect your data. It‚Äôs just good, clean, mid-90s VR fun.

item.title: Gen.G Officially Out Of Valorant Champions 2024
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/gen-g-officially-out-of-valorant-champions-2024/

Popular esports team, Gen.G, who had been competing in Valorant Champions 2024, is officially out of the competition following a major loss against Sentinels early this afternoon (August 10, 2024).

While things had been going strong for the team since the beginning of the event (which began on August 1), it would seem like their run has finally come to an end.

Gen.G Out Of Valorant Champions 2024 After Loss To Sentinels

Following their loss against Sentinels, Gen.G will officially be going home. The esports team had recently swept Sentinels during their Group Stage matches back on August 1, but it seems like Sentinels had prepared themselves for today‚Äôs matches.

Gen.G had lost 2-1 back on August 6 against Team Heretics, but their loss then was not enough to let them fall out of the event. Now, after their matches today against Sentinels, Gen.G will officially be going home.

Sentinels Vs. Gen.G Score:

  • 2-0

It would seem like Sentinels weren‚Äôt going to go down without a fight, as the team swept Gen.G, just like Gen.G had to them before. The first match took place on the Lotus map, where Sentinels won 13-9. The second match took place on the Icebox map, where Sentinels won 13-6.

Sentinels Move On To Playoffs

Sentinels have officially moved on to Playoffs following their win against Gen.G. While the official Playoffs schedule has not been released, as all matches are currently to be decided, we do know that games begin on August 16.

Today‚Äôs matches were Sentinels‚Äô first win in the entire series. It will be interesting to see how they follow up on today‚Äôs victory and whether or not they will continue with their momentum.

Make sure to keep updated on the action by viewing the Valorant Champions 2024 schedule.

item.title: PlayStation is introducing user reviews on the PS Store
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/playstation-is-introducing-user-reviews-on-the-ps-store

Much review about nothing.

It looks like PlayStation is introducing user reviews on the PS Store.

In a thread entitled "When did PlayStation start allowing written reviews?", an eagle-eyed PS5 owner noted on the PlayStation subreddit that the company was inviting user reviews for a select number of games.

Whilst fans have long been able to rate games from zero to five stars out of five, this is the first time players have been invited to leave a written review.

According to some respondents, PlayStation.com is emailing players and inviting them to share their thoughts on a handful of games, including Helldivers 2, Fortnite, Resident Evil 4, and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth.

When did PlayStation start allowing written reviews? Seems to only be allowed for few games on their store pages for now.
byu/cusman78 inplaystation

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As some commenters opine, the success of user reviews does vary, with many pointing out how useful Valve's listing of how many hours a player has played thus far, and also how much they'd played at the time they left a review.

Right now, the feature seems to be limited to a handful of games, you have to have a digital version of the game to participate, and reviews can only be submitted via the PlayStation.com site, too; as some players point out, this isn't necessarily a bad thing given it may be quite laborious to have to write out a full review using nowt but a controller.

Interestingly, Valve also recently revealed it was shaking up reviews by introducing a new filter system to help players sift out user reviews not deemed "helpful".

As spotted by a member of the Steam subreddit, Valve appears to have briefly activated a "helpfulness system" that essentially hid joke or silly reviews from view.

item.title: When Is The Next Tarkov Wipe? | Summer 2024 EFT Wipe
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/next-escape-from-tarkov-wipe/

If you‚Äôre an avid Escape From Tarkov fan, then this question starts to lurk around inside your head once every so often: ‚ÄòWhen is the next Tarkov wipe?‚Äô It‚Äôs a monumental event ‚Äì that game-wide refresh that rests everyone back to level pegging in an instant, and it often brings white-hot content updates pouring into the game.

When is the next Escape From Tarkov wipe, and what is it going to look like?

What Is a Wipe In Tarkov?

When Escape From Tarkov ‚Äòwipes‚Äô, every player is reset to level one, and their entire ‚Äòstash‚Äô ‚Äì which is their collection weapons, equipment, money, and so on ‚Äì is completely pushed back to the state it was when they first purchased the game. From there, players must once again climb the ladder, build their empire, complete early-game tasks, and rebuild their in-game hideout.

Read More: Is Escape From Tarkov Single-Player?

It‚Äôs a balancing mechanic, as it ensures that all players will at one point be matched in terms of equipment and opportunities. It also ensures that the game is kept somewhat fresh, as there is a point when the most experienced Escape From Tarkov players will simply have nothing left to do in the game but play it.

When a wipe hits, it typically brings with it a major update. These updates change the face of the game, often introducing entirely new maps, modes, characters, weapons ‚Äì even new movement mechanics and physics elements.

Does Tarkov PvE Wipe?

In 2024, Battlestate Games opened up Tarkov‚Äôs PvE offering much more universally, giving players worldwide the ability to take advantage of this ‚Äòoffline‚Äô platform. It works differently compared to the ‚Äòtraditional‚Äô game as it doesn‚Äôt wipe automatically. Players can trigger a manual wipe whenever they‚Äôd like, but otherwise, they‚Äôre free to keep playing on the same character for as long as they like.

When Is The Next Tarkov Wipe?

It has been confirmed that the next Escape from Tarkov wipe will take place in August 2024. It‚Äôs expected that it‚Äôll arrive in the third week of the month, starting from the 19th. It‚Äôll be accompanied by an ambitious Twitch Drops campaign as usual.

Read More: Why Is Escape From Tarkov So Hard?

Here‚Äôs some data about the last Escape From Tarkov wipes, such as how long they lasted and when they took place:

  • December 27, 2023, Lasted 139 days
  • August 10, 2023, Lasted 225 days
  • December 28, 2022, Lasted 183 days
  • June 28, 2022, Lasted 198 days
  • December 12, 2021, Lasted 165 days
  • June 30, 2021, Lasted 188 days
  • December 24, 2020, Lasted 210 days
  • May 28, 2020, Lasted 214 days
  • October 27, 2019, Lasted 201 days

The current wipe, which went live at the end of December 2023, is the longest Tarkov wipe ever.

How To Tell When Tarkov Is Going To Wipe

Traditionally, Battlestate Games, the developer of Escape From Tarkov, will start scheduling special events just before a wipe is due to hit. In the past, Escape From Tarkov‚Äôs wipe events have been:

  • Maximum-value loot spawning in very specific locations on the map
  • All the game‚Äôs bosses spawn on the same map
  • Players spawning in poisoned and need to find a cure
  • Players spawning in with a ‚Äòstim‚Äô injector that could give them ‚Äòsuper soldier abilities‚Äô
  • In-game traders offering their wares for just a few coins
  • Multiple loot airdrops falling in all at once

If the Tarkov events start ramping up, then you know that the next Escape From Tarkov wipe is starting soon.

Read Next: Is Escape From Tarkov Free To Play?

Frequently Asked Questions

  1. What was the longest wipe in Tarkov?
    • The longest wipe in Tarkov lasted 226 days (at the time of writing), running from December 28, 2023, to August 10, 2024.
  2. What was the shortest wipe in Tarkov?
    • The shortest wipe in Tarkov lasted just 60 days, running from October 27, 2017, to December 26, 2017.
  3. Do you lose everything when Tarkov wipes?
    • Yes, when Tarkov wipes, you lose everything including game progress, money, and stash contents.
  4. Does the Tarkov wipe delete your hideout?
    • Yes, when Tarkov wipes, you‚Äôll lose your entire hideout and will need to rebuild it from scratch.
  5. When is the next Escape from Tarkov wipe?
    • See above!

Escape From Tarkov is available exclusively on PC.

item.title: Best Summer Crops In Stardew Valley
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/best-summer-crops-in-stardew-valley/1100-6525175/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Growing and harvesting crops is one of the best ways to make money in Stardew Valley and the Summer season has a few different great options to maximize your profits. Summer has multiple standout options for making money, but it also has a few crops that really aren't worth growing due to low profits.

Best Summer crops

The best crops to grow in Summer for profit are blueberries, melons, starfruit, and red cabbage. Starfruit seeds are only profitable if bought from the Oasis shop or made from a seed maker and red cabbage isn't available at Pierre's until Year 2. The absolute best option is the blueberries, since the plants continue to reproduce throughout the season, so you don't have to buy more seeds. Each plant gives multiple blueberries each harvest, drastically increasing the crop's overall value.

While it can be tempting to only focus on the most profitable crops, if you are going down the community center path, you will need a variety of crops to complete the bundles needed to unlock the Greenhouse.

Similar to cauliflower in Spring, melons are profitable, but due to their long growth time, you will only get two paydays from them during the season. If you want to spread out your income a bit better, it's good to mix in a few crops with shorter turnaround times. Corn is also a great crop to plant. While it isn't as profitable for each harvest, corn continues to produce and it's a hybrid crop, able to grow during Summer and Fall. That means you can plant a cornfield at the beginning of Summer, and it will produce corn all the way through the end of Fall.

Below you can find a table containing every Spring crop, the cost of their seeds, time it takes to harvest, and sell prices.
